info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:53PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Madera and northeastern Fresno Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 452 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles southeast of Oakhurst, or 27 miles southeast of Yosemite South Entrance, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nature Point, Huntington Lake, Peckinpah, Shaver Lake, North Fork and Shaver Lake 3ne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
